comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: FAO Archivist SDASM....On  the full-size scan does the marking under the RH wing read F-L?  This aircraft has the Cross of Lorraine on the tail so attached to the Free French but I believe not captured from the Vichy French until after Operation Torch (end 1942). The Free French had used the markings 'FL- 'from  1942 but swiftly changed that to' FC-'  but ' F-L' is new to me although the use of 3 letter suffixes like QBE was common. Are the dates Jack Canary was in N. Africa known?

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/74784995@N00] It does appear to be F-L but if you email me at arenga@sdasm.org I can send you a large file, maybe you can tell better. Unfortunately, we do not know when he was in North Africa...
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: There is another photo (archived very large) of 'QBE' at Hamburg (so plainly post-WWII )at freepages.military.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~tmi45/bernard%2... On this the RH underwing marks seem to be removed 'QBE' got around...it was recorded at Croydon (London) in the immediate post-war period, too
